content: My name is Max Müller from Germany.
name: Max Müller

content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Max Müller

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price of an apartment in Magdeburg.
name: Max Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Max Müller

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: There was no final price agreed upon.
name: Max Müller

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner as a 1.
name: Max Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: Yes, at some points during the negotiation, I felt discriminated against or offended.
name: Max Müller

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: I felt discriminated against or offended because the negotiation partner made it clear that they were not interested in finding a fair price that would work for both parties. Instead, they repeatedly stated that they were a greedy landlord who was solely focused on getting the highest possible price, regardless of my financial situation or the value of the apartment. This approach made me feel that my needs as a student were not being respected or considered, and it gave me the impression that the negotiation was not based on mutual respect and understanding.
name: Max Müller
